8bb37899-24ee-405b-b33b-4da304e3d016.title: Appendix F - Entropy Documentation And Assessment

da39f7c1-78dc-4cc0-a564-4f607d511f6f.title: Terms
da39f7c1-78dc-4cc0-a564-4f607d511f6f.text: The following sections list Common Criteria and technology terms used in this document.

threats.securityProblemDefinition:
The security problem is described in terms
		of the threats that the TOE is expected to address, assumptions about the
		operational environment, and any organizational security policies that the TOE
		is expected to enforce.

9d813e26-364b-4149-ae05-f2459b2d76d5.title: Security Objectives for the Operational Environment

a0cf8b42-e169-4532-8503-21bc616f37f7.title: Class ADV: Development
a0cf8b42-e169-4532-8503-21bc616f37f7.summary:
The information about the TOE
        is contained in the guidance documentation available to the end user as
        well as the TSS portion of the ST. The TOE developer 
        must concur with the description of the product that is contained in the TSS as it relates 
        to the functional requirements. The evaluation activities contained in 
         <xref to="SFRs"></xref> should provide the ST authors with sufficient information to 
        determine the appropriate content for the TSS section.

98ef0157-1342-4080-ad38-dc7e80b87de3.title: Class AGD: Guidance Documents
98ef0157-1342-4080-ad38-dc7e80b87de3.summary:
The guidance documents will be
        provided with the ST. Guidance must include a description of how the IT personnel verifies
        that the Operational Environment can fulfill its role for the security functionality. The
        documentation should be in an informal style and readable by the IT personnel. Guidance must
        be provided for every operational environment that the product supports as claimed in the
        ST. This guidance includes instructions to successfully install the TSF in
        that environment; and Instructions to manage the security of the TSF as a 
        product and as a component of the larger operational environment. Guidance pertaining to 
        particular security functionality is also provided; requirements on such guidance are 
        contained in the evaluation activities specified with each requirement.

bb5be9c4-d340-41eb-8204-4338b5f563f7.title: Class ALC: Life-cycle Support
bb5be9c4-d340-41eb-8204-4338b5f563f7.summary:
At the assurance level provided for TOEs conformant to this PP, life-cycle support is limited
        to end-user-visible aspects of the life-cycle, rather than an examination of the TOE vendor’s
        development and configuration management process. This is not meant to diminish the
        critical role that a developer’s practices play in contributing to the overall trustworthiness of a
        product; rather, it is a reflection on the information to be made available for evaluation at this
        assurance level.

458718a6-8712-4f13-b203-9d8343fdc51d.title: Class ASE: ST Evaluation
458718a6-8712-4f13-b203-9d8343fdc51d.summary: As per ASE activities defined in  <xref to="bibCEM"></xref>.

656adb48-4083-4cf4-8fb8-e46ba33d94c3.title: Class ATE: Tests
656adb48-4083-4cf4-8fb8-e46ba33d94c3.summary:
Testing is specified for functional aspects of
        the system as well as aspects that take advantage of design or implementation weaknesses.
        The former is done through the ATE_IND family, while the latter is through the AVA_VAN
        family. At the assurance level specified in this PP, testing is based on advertised
        functionality and interfaces with dependency on the availability of design information. One
        of the primary outputs of the evaluation process is the test report as specified in the
        following requirements.

b3c4a7d8-615e-4257-bfff-1c34c39c3f18.title: Class AVA: Vulnerability Assessment
b3c4a7d8-615e-4257-bfff-1c34c39c3f18.summary:
For the current generation of
        this protection profile, the evaluation lab is expected to survey open sources to discover
        what vulnerabilities have been discovered in these types of products. In most cases, these
        vulnerabilities will require sophistication beyond that of a basic attacker. Until
        penetration tools are created and uniformly distributed to the evaluation labs, the
        evaluator will not be expected to test for these vulnerabilities in the TOE. The labs will be expected to comment on the likelihood of these vulnerabilities given
        the documentation provided by the vendor. This information will be used in the development
        of penetration testing tools and for the development of future protection profiles.

603b69e2-9ee5-4d34-8a1a-09bb8bcd4fd6.name: Basic Functional Specification (ADV_FSP.1)
603b69e2-9ee5-4d34-8a1a-09bb8bcd4fd6.summary: The functional specification describes the TSFIs. It is not necessary to have a formal or complete specification of these interfaces. Additionally, because TOEs conforming to this PP will necessarily have interfaces to the Operational Environment that are not directly invocable by TOE users, there is little point specifying that such interfaces be described in and of themselves since only indirect testing of such interfaces may be possible. For this PP, the activities for this family should focus on understanding the interfaces presented in the TSS in response to the functional requirements and the interfaces presented in the AGD documentation. No additional “functional specification” documentation is necessary to satisfy the evaluation activities specified. The interfaces that need to be evaluated are characterized through the information needed to perform the assurance activities listed, rather than as an independent, abstract list.

eeccfb61-e850-4fc5-b62b-aaa31057098a.name: Labeling of the TOE (ALC_CMC.1)
eeccfb61-e850-4fc5-b62b-aaa31057098a.summary:
This component is targeted at identifying the TOE such that it can be distinguished from
			other products or versions from the same vendor and can be easily specified when being
			procured by an end user.

b83ac0a4-f8f3-4b5e-bfff-f6700154f107.name: Timely Security Updates
b83ac0a4-f8f3-4b5e-bfff-f6700154f107.summary:
This component requires the TOE developer, in conjunction with any other necessary parties,
			to provide information as to how the end-user devices are updated to address security issues
			in a timely manner. The documentation describes the process of providing updates to the
			public from the time a security flaw is reported/discovered, to the time an update is released.
			This description includes the parties involved (e.g., the developer, carriers(s)) and the steps
			that are performed (e.g., developer testing, carrier testing), including worst case time periods,
			before an update is made available to the public.

a058206f-83a7-41c3-a071-20cfefaaff06.name: ST Objectives for the Operational Environment

09e535e0-8024-4335-8a10-c51d4f6e1d99.name: Independent Testing – Conformance (ATE_IND.1)
09e535e0-8024-4335-8a10-c51d4f6e1d99.summary:
Testing is performed to confirm the
			functionality described in the TSS as well as the administrative
			(including configuration and operational) documentation provided. The focus of the testing
			is to confirm that the requirements specified in  <xref to="SFRs"></xref> being met,
			although some additional testing is specified for SARs in  <xref to="SARs"></xref>. The
			evaluation activities identify the additional testing activities associated with these
			components. The evaluator produces a test report documenting the plan for and results of
			testing, as well as coverage arguments focused on the platform/TOE
			combinations that are claiming conformance to this PP. Given the scope of the 
			TOE and its associated evaluation evidence requirements, this 
			component’s evaluation activities are covered by the evaluation activities listed for ALC_CMC.1.

5bd40dbb-373d-43d2-a325-3a010e7595ab.title: The developer shall provide a functional specification.

b85628f5-0657-4b58-aa95-7f71b2e760a4.title:
The developer shall provide a tracing from the functional specification to the
					SFRs.

9a79d168-351e-4e90-a238-07819d2bfbbc.title:
The functional specification shall describe the purpose and method of use for
					each SFR-enforcing and SFR-supporting TSFI.

2ddd021b-5773-4e93-81d0-68aa3fa84fd8.title:
The functional specification shall identify all parameters associated with each
					SFR-enforcing and SFR-supporting TSFI.

75ecbec2-4c23-4fc9-ae90-b856f34d463d.title:
The functional specification shall provide rationale for the implicit
					categorization of interfaces as SFR-non-interfering.

b19350c6-d66a-488d-a73b-e85d9a11fa54.title: The tracing shall demonstrate that the SFRs trace to TSFIs in the functional specification.

94aeef92-9420-46ff-892e-c59ef3f73d5f.title:
The evaluator shall confirm that the information provided meets all requirements
					for content and presentation of evidence.

f67a5b28-b654-45e6-8bb0-115445eac25d.title:
The evaluator shall determine that the functional specification is an accurate
					and complete instantiation of the SFRs.

d4d7b832-2587-40c5-9306-5fbec73fff86.title: The developer shall provide operational user guidance.

6997739e-e5bb-4967-9733-6364487eaf61.title:
The operational user guidance shall describe, for each user role, the
					user-accessible functions and privileges that should be controlled in a secure
					processing environment, including appropriate warnings.

ca365738-87e8-40eb-968e-657f832b1b2a.title:
The operational user guidance shall describe, for each user role, how to use the
					available interfaces provided by the TOE in a secure manner.

68d54c30-0cff-4cba-852e-8fc76703d7ce.title:
The operational user guidance shall describe, for each user role, the available
					functions and interfaces, in particular all security parameters under the control of
					the user, indicating secure values as appropriate.

8cfe422b-d06b-47da-a555-81a850cbc931.title:
The operational user guidance shall, for each user role, clearly present each
					type of security-relevant event relative to the user-accessible functions that need to
					be performed, including changing the security characteristics of entities under the
					control of the TSF.

b6fcd0da-b7d6-4ca2-a54f-c35bd34386e8.title:
The operational user guidance shall identify all possible modes of operation of
					the TOE (including operation following failure or operational
					error), their consequences, and implications for maintaining secure operation.

038453a7-4f99-475c-988c-837658bf1bee.title:
The operational user guidance shall, for each user role, describe the security
					measures to be followed in order to fulfill the security objectives for the
					operational environment as described in the ST.

c63fb973-0141-4c0e-9efd-fff01f5d2b3a.title: The operational user guidance shall be clear and reasonable.

5a682496-0787-43e0-a7e4-dc1ef72a844e.title:
The evaluator shall confirm that the information provided meets all requirements
					for content and presentation of evidence.

b38cacae-bd86-4c01-8731-fd35bb81c918.title: The developer shall provide the TOE, including its preparative procedures.

de7b13a7-74f9-491f-afa9-3319028bff5c.title:
The preparative procedures shall describe all the steps necessary for secure
					acceptance of the delivered TOE in accordance with the developer's
					delivery procedures.

6f2d6a13-e147-4e68-a46d-8b1d2cfc334c.title:
The preparative procedures shall describe all the steps necessary for secure
					installation of the TOE and for the secure preparation of the
					operational environment in accordance with the security objectives for the operational
					environment as described in the ST.

55d74380-442f-4d7a-a508-dca1ab990047.title:
The evaluator shall confirm that the information provided meets all requirements
					for content and presentation of evidence.

68f45768-3f1c-4359-9e88-ab65242058a7.title:
The evaluator shall apply the preparative procedures to confirm that the TOE
					can be prepared securely for operation.

b4bd735b-5bb8-42b9-ad11-9032ee096e1d.title: The developer shall provide the TOE and a reference for the TOE.

1bdb4e66-8f8e-45b7-9e8d-0d704648630e.title: The application shall be labeled with a unique reference.

5a593346-0fdc-433c-8eb2-55a7d06bf4f8.title:
The evaluator shall confirm that the information provided meets all
					requirements for content and presentation of evidence.

5b77249f-ebea-4f54-95b1-9d4a74c3ea1f.title: The developer shall provide a configuration list for the TOE.

c1e39f3e-f083-4dc8-9e15-17689d57f7a5.title:
The configuration list shall include the following: the TOE
					itself; and the evaluation evidence required by the SARs.

f3842fbe-7d8d-42ae-9d87-f56c0df1dc2a.title: The configuration list shall uniquely identify the configuration items.

bd13f5bc-5779-4bb5-a78c-8fdf402e0e37.title:
The evaluator shall confirm that the information provided meets all requirements
					for content and presentation of evidence.

88b321ae-068c-4bc7-91a5-a0ea9ba65408.title: The flaw remediation procedures documentation shall describe the procedures used to track all reported security flaws in each release of the TOE.

2877aadd-67a5-4a77-90fe-c5813c6f97a8.title: The developer shall document and provide flaw remediation procedures addressed to TOE developers.

abd1c8ff-0712-4f18-a2fe-98746c1377b4.title: The evaluator shall confirm that the information provided meets all requirements for content and presentation of evidence.

9ed62a78-e50a-457a-882c-c1652727cf92.title: The flaw remediation procedures shall require that a description of the nature and effect of each security flaw be provided, as well as the status of finding a correction to that flaw.

30a41736-3f5b-48b3-9989-cf6c9c3db06d.title: The flaw remediation procedures shall require that corrective actions be identified for each of the security flaws.

60243663-3ad7-4cf1-a8d4-7c4d6d65924b.title: The flaw remediation procedures documentation shall describe the methods used to provide flaw information, corrections and guidance on corrective actions to TOE users.

8111c6b0-27c4-45e4-834e-fa0ac9eb72d6.title: The flaw remediation procedures documentation shall describe the procedures used to track all reported security flaws in each release of the TOE.

503dd79b-e2e3-4e14-a1ec-0267aea23969.title: The developer shall document and provide flaw remediation procedures addressed to TOE developers.

831f3442-6f07-435d-a88f-7c9ad867145b.title: The evaluator shall confirm that the information provided meets all requirements for content and presentation of evidence.

6c0237c3-426c-4b31-a294-1e8491053db5.title: The flaw remediation procedures shall require that a description of the nature and effect of each security flaw be provided, as well as the status of finding a correction to that flaw.

8d07838b-f811-4dfa-8dc2-dc73d5e09b91.title: The developer shall establish a procedure for accepting and acting upon all reports of security flaws and requests for corrections to those flaws.

bbd99b32-f8a4-42d2-96ef-6dd0728c2dc9.title: The flaw remediation procedures shall require that corrective actions be identified for each of the security flaws.

0b5a20c1-9e3a-40d0-99e6-6985a0882e68.title: The developer shall provide flaw remediation guidance addressed to TOE users.

c9771138-6cc3-4648-a0e6-d8b31eed4080.title: The flaw remediation procedures documentation shall describe the methods used to provide flaw information, corrections and guidance on corrective actions to TOE users.

9773e230-c0b4-4c5f-87a7-e93c95c1ce16.title: The flaw remediation procedures shall describe a means by which the developer receives from TOE users reports and enquiries of suspected security flaws in the TOE.

5e14a7df-9a81-44a5-80bc-58d2bcc5019d.title: The procedures for processing reported security flaws shall ensure that any reported flaws are remediated and the remediation procedures issued to TOE users.

c6cff24b-c185-4ec1-8b9b-2b091311f988.title: The procedures for processing reported security flaws shall provide safeguards that any corrections to these security flaws do not introduce any new flaws.

35a418fe-b5ac-41c6-b000-206b94d9f843.title: The flaw remediation guidance shall describe a means by which TOE users report to the developer any suspected security flaws in the TOE.

0cfbaf3d-0ba3-43bf-97c6-303a6e4781ff.title: The flaw remediation procedures documentation shall describe the procedures used to track all reported security flaws in each release of the TOE.

f7c80ccd-3236-4c7a-bd57-34f5a8942657.title: The developer shall document and provide flaw remediation procedures addressed to TOE developers.

e8cc98c7-f58d-4ac3-85f0-4db878f3e13e.title: The evaluator shall confirm that the information provided meets all requirements for content and presentation of evidence.

f0fb81bf-ba67-4d87-8641-fb7a679cca84.title: The flaw remediation procedures shall require that a description of the nature and effect of each security flaw be provided, as well as the status of finding a correction to that flaw.

6fa3d73a-f6b8-4afb-a32f-5575523f1138.title: The developer shall establish a procedure for accepting and acting upon all reports of security flaws and requests for corrections to those flaws.

40b72ea8-b845-4c56-bc9f-fe9d3094d380.title: The flaw remediation procedures shall require that corrective actions be identified for each of the security flaws.

b223ec44-0881-4368-9318-4facf8ac9098.title: The developer shall provide flaw remediation guidance addressed to TOE users.

4c704920-b855-41ab-85c2-fb461ca906f5.title: The flaw remediation procedures documentation shall describe the methods used to provide flaw information, corrections and guidance on corrective actions to TOE users.

d884703b-4bc8-4476-8d6d-4b36a20e435c.title: The flaw remediation procedures shall describe a means by which the developer receives from TOE users reports and enquiries of suspected security flaws in the TOE.

6b23dc87-f61d-4afb-b342-41a2b055b910.title: The flaw remediation procedures shall include a procedure requiring timely response and the automatic distribution of security flaw reports and the associated corrections to registered users who might be affected by the security flaw.

94a93812-da99-4ed3-b97e-4d3c9a0201c7.title: The procedures for processing reported security flaws shall ensure that any reported flaws are remediated and the remediation procedures issued to TOE users.

432c4be1-6420-453c-af74-81145aebf32c.title: The procedures for processing reported security flaws shall provide safeguards that any corrections to these security flaws do not introduce any new flaws.

f4edd731-38bb-41b0-8586-8212ea88947b.title: The flaw remediation guidance shall describe a means by which TOE users report to the developer any suspected security flaws in the TOE.

783baf19-e88e-46a5-87e5-e34d3108b147.title: The flaw remediation guidance shall describe a means by which TOE users may register with the developer, to be eligible to receive security flaw reports and corrections.

552ba9ca-617e-48a9-909f-08dff38b1334.title: The flaw remediation guidance shall identify the specific points of contact for all reports and enquiries about security issues involving the TOE.

993da652-7015-48f7-8471-69c35cfa07dc.title: The conformance claim shall identify the edition of the CC to which the ST and the TOE claim conformance.

c6362a79-3bec-40a1-9e57-1822a3b65f46.title: The developer shall provide a conformance claim.

ead78c67-4ad2-49ee-a94e-37c746cccf89.title: The evaluator shall confirm that the information provided meets all requirements for content and presentation of evidence.

3dca8623-b24a-4909-b16c-58b4ba16a0e0.title: The conformance claim shall describe the conformance of the ST to CC Part 2 as either CC Part 2 conformant or CC Part 2 extended.

a44879c0-367b-4b2f-a01f-6c8873b1d09a.title: The developer shall provide a conformance claim rationale.

0fbc1cf9-c436-4c0b-a3ae-a8f1dbefd494.title: The conformance claim shall describe the conformance of the ST as either “CC Part 3 conformant” or “CC Part 3 extended”.

69680fe7-7e47-49da-a2a5-c1478672159f.title: The conformance claim shall be consistent with the extended components definition.

bea42399-1b87-4bd6-9304-d3a6dd371e46.title: The conformance claim shall identify a PP-Configuration, or all PPs and security requirement packages to which the ST claims conformance.

2e32426b-210d-4ac1-acfd-1d9ce0a2e0a3.title: The conformance claim shall describe any conformance of the ST to a package as either package-conformant or package-augmented.

b9050087-d9e9-4f44-b65f-7b5a1b6f292f.title: The conformance claim shall describe any conformance of the ST to a PP as PP-Conformant.

8d6b0b05-8327-4bfc-a61a-47b1697c0e0b.title: The conformance claim rationale shall demonstrate that the TOE type is consistent with the TOE type in the PP-Configuration or PPs for which conformance is being claimed.

dd576d61-c7cf-4a01-a390-0cad613b7908.title: The conformance claim rationale shall demonstrate that the statement of the security problem definition is consistent with the statement of the security problem definition in the PP-Configuration, PPs and any functional packages for which conformance is being claimed.

b1753b61-3507-47c6-be0d-b8490cdd7a07.title: The conformance claim rationale shall demonstrate that the statement of security objectives is consistent with the statement of security objectives in the PP-Configuration, PPs, and any functional package for which conformance is being claimed.

fb662011-11b5-4627-93ab-bbb6b241b43d.title: The conformance claim rationale shall demonstrate that the statement of security requirements is consistent with the statement of security requirements in the PP-Configuration, PPs, and any functional packages for which conformance is being claimed.

8f982490-5d1f-44db-8835-4a8228f786f8.title: The conformance claim for PP(s) or a PP-Configuration shall be exact, strict, or demonstrable or a list of conformance types.

736f6a44-b68e-4db7-9920-3ee9bab47d3f.title: If the conformance claim identifies a set of Evaluation methods and Evaluation activities derived from CEM work units that shall be used to evaluate the TOE then this set shall include all those that are included in any package, PP, or PP-Module in a PP-Configuration  to which the ST claims conformance, and no others.

946a5492-72a3-42b0-bb0c-924568d87fc0.title: The statement of security requirements shall identify all extended security requirements.

29dfcb77-d3e9-4a57-922c-d6e73431ac7a.title: The developer shall provide a statement of security requirements.

afff1de3-4575-4bd1-a44d-c274a9ea65a9.title: The evaluator shall confirm that the information provided meets all requirements for content and presentation of evidence.

e1991efc-30c0-4e62-8790-81337a4cfce2.title: The extended components definition shall define an extended component for each extended security requirement.

79e75639-f6ec-472b-9458-829ecf58ae5d.title: The developer shall provide an extended components definition.

0c7921de-06b6-49a9-8a1e-e91b7c15277e.title: The evaluator shall confirm that no extended component may be clearly expressed using existing components.

9789121d-e279-40c4-8dee-259dd5fa4bd3.title: The extended components definition shall describe how each extended component is related to the existing CC components, families, and classes.

6f1e155d-8760-438f-b09c-dc43568da562.title: The extended components definition shall use the existing CC components, families, classes, and methodology as a model for presentation.

915f8e10-3a88-45e8-8645-cd707380b502.title: The extended components shall consist of measurable and objective elements such that conformance or nonconformance to these elements may be demonstrated.

069c0823-ebf2-46c3-8b44-654da986aa48.title: The ST introduction shall contain an ST reference, a TOE reference, a TOE overview and a TOE description.

00027c5d-c110-4c69-bd6e-ad182de16bbe.title: The developer shall provide an ST introduction.

02abb315-c7bb-4222-9209-a7f324f9556b.title: The evaluator shall confirm that the information provided meets all requirements for content and presentation of evidence.

77b33f10-2f9a-43df-b396-ac9958b55978.title: The ST reference shall uniquely identify the ST.

5613e6d2-f3ca-4acf-81f7-257312d7fc0b.title: The evaluator shall confirm that the TOE reference, the TOE overview, and the TOE description are consistent with each other.

29d2b8c2-3446-4b37-9ca9-25dec2015c03.title: The TOE reference shall uniquely identify the TOE.

92d70162-67d8-4f1e-9659-5d02c5647ed2.title: The TOE overview shall summarize the usage and major security features of the TOE.

890f870e-964b-46ce-b997-44270962f509.title: The TOE overview shall identify the TOE type.

9e383688-6e08-4595-aa64-cb63479ef4c7.title: The TOE overview shall identify any non-TOE hardware/software/firmware required by the TOE.

4a06f4f3-5ca3-42a3-9a1d-3857990d87ce.title: For a multi-assurance ST, the TOE overview shall describe the TSF organization in terms of the sub-TSFs defined in the PP-Configuration the ST claims conformance to.

636b3740-385f-4181-a44b-d804d2a78ea8.title: The TOE description shall describe the physical scope of the TOE.

e818ee31-6256-496f-8696-bba4e65fc522.title: The TOE description shall describe the logical scope of the TOE.

a299a370-4fd9-4554-8ae4-1f9c459feba7.title: The statement of security objectives shall describe the security objectives for the operational environment.

52805936-f547-4018-9f72-fd7680a2ff58.title: The developer shall provide a statement of security objectives for the operational environment.

c1372e6a-b29f-4f9b-81b2-10ee0a91f294.title: The evaluator shall confirm that the information provided meets all requirements for content and presentation of evidence.

1dc17b75-5408-41c4-8f77-7536f8ef3a76.title: The security objectives rationale shall trace each security objective for the operational environment back to threats countered by that security objective, OSPs enforced by that security objective, and assumptions upheld by that security objective.

84224ece-e512-450f-ae5d-bda8b75d8969.title: The developer shall provide a security objectives rationale for the operational environment.

0bc283c9-3afe-453a-a0be-7baf67f5fee7.title: The security objectives rationale shall demonstrate that the security objectives for the operational environment uphold all assumptions.

6f638343-2017-4a6e-8acf-a46ad20adf96.title: The statement of security requirements shall describe the SFRs and the SARs.

a0cd0e87-acbb-4ad9-98bc-3ea9223f21a0.title: The developer shall provide a statement of security requirements.

37c7a0b8-19a0-49f9-a8e0-646f66397c49.title: The evaluator shall confirm that the information provided meets all requirements for content and presentation of evidence.

75832874-d6fa-48c7-95c8-c22545f18fca.title: For a single-assurance ST, the statement of security requirements shall define the global set of SARs that apply to the entire TOE. The sets of SARs shall be consistent with the PPs or PP-Configuration to which the ST claims conformance.

2e6cd88d-d798-4d22-93aa-bc003ba42f59.title: The developer shall provide a security requirements rationale.

18888829-1014-4cb5-b448-72abf055edd2.title: For a multi-assurance ST, the statement of security requirements shall define the global set of SARs that apply to the entire TOE and the sets of SARs that apply to each sub-TSF. The sets of SARs shall be consistent with the multi-assurance PP-Configuration to which the ST claims conformance.

3d696f96-57c8-4c73-bd31-9059422b5d95.title: All subjects, objects, operations, security attributes, external entities and other terms that are used in the SFRs and the SARs shall be defined.

d4e257d6-ed26-4b3e-b18a-1f1f135fdd4a.title: The statement of security requirements shall identify all operations on the security requirements.

dcb9bfb8-f441-468d-a170-5e82346d5e19.title: All operations shall be performed correctly.

15498df5-93e3-4bb8-a9cf-c0270eb7753e.title: Each dependency of the security requirements shall either be satisfied, or the security requirements rationale shall justify the dependency not being satisfied.

bb5c07f3-b116-493a-9893-4e0bc52c0107.title: The security requirements rationale shall demonstrate that the SFRs (in conjunction with the security objectives for the environment) counter all threats for the TOE.

08147402-cb0c-4e67-a462-73e8803b22de.title: The security requirements rationale shall demonstrate that the SFRs (in conjunction with the security objectives for the environment) enforce all OSPs.

2c5528be-ad49-476b-9df2-d5df444b1ca1.title: The security requirements rationale shall explain why the SARs were chosen.

e4e9800a-5fdc-432c-aca7-1dfb1e22b7dc.title: The statement of security requirements shall be internally consistent.

acb694f5-b2b4-4928-bfb0-a92bd4dc82a9.title: If the ST defines sets of SARs that expand the sets of SARs of the PPs or PP-Configuration it claims conformance to, the security requirements rationale shall include an assurance rationale that justifies the consistency of the extension and provides a rationale for the disposition of any Evaluation methods and Evaluation activities identified in the conformance statement that are affected by the extension of the sets of SARs

10780db5-4e56-486a-aded-e7cca2011557.title: The TOE summary specification shall describe how the TOE meets each SFR.

7585b817-70a3-45aa-a71d-0721ad56ca52.title: The developer shall provide a TOE summary specification.

d067284e-b0a7-4409-ac4b-d4f0d6aa089c.title: The evaluator shall confirm that the information provided meets all requirements for content and presentation of evidence.

8528e76a-42b2-4637-9c03-673f25bafbf8.title: The evaluator shall confirm that the TOE summary specification is consistent with the TOE overview and the TOE description.

5520c4de-6cfc-4211-bc91-b9293d41876a.title:
The developer shall provide a description in the TSS of how timely
					security updates are made to the TOE.

aa17820c-1d94-4d42-ad60-e3cb7070ff32.title:
The developer shall provide a description in the TSS of how users are notified when 
					updates change security properties or the configuration of the product.

e4bbbcf2-59c3-4976-8d50-2222b497e326.title:
The description shall include the process for creating and deploying
				security updates for the TOE software.

8218896f-2da7-40a2-9af1-1ae82a668dfb.title:
The description shall express the time window as the length of time, 
					in days, between public disclosure of a vulnerability and the public availability
					of security updates to the TOE.

6d0b014e-9b65-4587-92fd-27ec79bc4149.title:
The description shall include the mechanisms publicly available for
					reporting security issues pertaining to the TOE.

da7d77ed-3fa0-470b-a4f1-cd64d43fa696.title:
The evaluator shall confirm that the information provided meets all
					requirements for content and presentation of evidence.

38c9f417-26b1-4f1b-8f28-cf8e502a04f1.title: The developer shall provide the TOE for testing.

5db9853e-b8a2-4402-83c3-484aa07c9f68.title: The TOE shall be suitable for testing.

c0dda7c7-5ec4-4567-a34d-c42346f2b3b6.title:
The evaluator shall confirm that the information provided meets all
					requirements for content and presentation of evidence.

9096f6cc-cc4c-4398-9a69-016e89b6fcb3.title:
The evaluator shall test a subset of the TSF to confirm
					that the TSF operates as specified.

fcd430d2-b5e2-4a02-990e-148b06734704.title: The developer shall provide the TOE for testing.

88958e14-e776-440a-bd3f-3fa1fe2195cc.title: The TOE shall be suitable for testing.

51a0b38d-ef2d-4a5d-93d0-8637123024fb.title:
The evaluator shall confirm that the information provided meets all requirements
					for content and presentation of evidence.

4d2615a0-3231-4be5-b03c-07d1bfc70d3b.title:
The evaluator shall perform a search of public domain sources to identify
					potential vulnerabilities in the TOE.

81b396e2-9f78-4a85-9890-5f10d3c5bf55.title:
The evaluator shall conduct penetration testing, based on the identified
					potential vulnerabilities, to determine that the TOE is resistant to
					attacks performed by an attacker possessing Basic attack potential.
